column4: hey guys, is it possible for me to auto-connect to my wireless network after i restart my pc?
do i need to install anything?
Nope - it ought to just happen as soon as you log in, once you've connected once.
Do you have compiz turned on?  If so, alt+f2 then "compiz --replace" (no quotes), otherwise use "metacity" instead of "compiz"
Thanks alot. It works "compiz --replace". Anyway, is there a place where they have a list of command for us to study? Guess I need to memorise quite a number of them.
You might consider adding a launcher to your panel if it happens to you a lot.
There's a few places, hang on while I dig up some links if you're interested.
Yes, I'm interested. Thanks a lot. :)
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal is as good a place as any to start, and has links to a good few other pages at the bottom.
thanks bookmarked. anyway, you mentioned a launcher, how do i go about doing it?

Assuming you're in Ubuntu as opposed to Kubuntu, right-click the panel and go "add to panel...", then choose "custom application launcher and enter your chosen command.  You might want to give it a nice custom icon too ;)
ahhh, alright i got it. Thanks mate. :)
quick question for you. i noticed my internet speed increases a lot compared to the time when i'm using windows xp.
Interesting.  If it's better, I'd just assume it's fine.  XP ought really to be working at the same speed though.
Hmm, sounds like there's something running in the background in XP that's either throttling your network or eating up your bandwidth.
To show hidden files in Nautilus (that's the GNOME file manager) you can press ctrl+h - but we warned, in your home folder there's LOADS.
The navigation panel is that bit with buttons for the folder you're in and those above it across the top - press the one at the left-hand end to get a text box, sorta like an address bar.
